stimulusHtml: Based on the image, which of the following statements best explains the impact of Christianity spreading to the Kingdom of Kongo?

features.html:
• The largest crucifix is in the center.
  • Above the largest crucifix is a small crucifix.
  • Below the largest crucifix is another small crucifix.

Gift of Ernst Anspach, 1999. The Metropolitan Museum of Art.

choicesHtml: The Kingdom of Kongo rejected Christianity and instead increased its connection to Islam, which became the dominant religion.
A distinct form of African Catholicism developed that incorporated elements of Christianity and local cultural traditions.
The Kingdom of Kongo used Roman Catholicism to access trade with regions in the Indian Ocean like the Arabian Peninsula and India.
Geâ€™ez script became the main liturgical language of African Catholicism, uniting the diverse people of West Central Africa.
